content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. Wildlife biologists are interested in the health of tule elk, a species of deer found in California. An important measurement of tule elk health is their weight. The weight of a tule elk is difficult to measure in the wild. However, chest circumference, which is believed to be related to the weight of a tule elk, can easily be measured from a safe distance using a harmless laser. A study was done to investigate whether chest circumference, in centimeters (<math alttext="c m" overflow="scroll"><mtext>cm</mtext></math>), could be used to accurately estimate the weight, in kilograms (<math alttext="k g" overflow="scroll"><mtext>kg</mtext></math>), of male tule elk. For the study, wildlife biologists captured <math alttext="30" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn></math> male tule elk, measured their chest circumference and weight, and then released the elk. The data for the <math alttext="30" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn></math> male tule elk are shown in the scatterplot. (a) Describe the relationship between chest circumference and weight of male tule elk in context.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. Wildlife biologists are interested in the health of tule elk, a species of deer found in California. An important measurement of tule elk health is their weight. The weight of a tule elk is difficult to measure in the wild. However, chest circumference, which is believed to be related to the weight of a tule elk, can easily be measured from a safe distance using a harmless laser. A study was done to investigate whether chest circumference, in centimeters (<math alttext="c m" overflow="scroll"><mtext>cm</mtext></math>), could be used to accurately estimate the weight, in kilograms (<math alttext="k g" overflow="scroll"><mtext>kg</mtext></math>), of male tule elk. For the study, wildlife biologists captured <math alttext="30" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn></math> male tule elk, measured their chest circumference and weight, and then released the elk. The data for the <math alttext="30" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn></math> male tule elk are shown in the scatterplot. (a) Describe the relationship between chest circumference and weight of male tule elk in context.

Following is the equation of the least-squares regression line relating chest circumference and weight for male tule elk. <math alttext="predicted weight equals negative 350.3 plus, 3.7455 times chest circumference" overflow="scroll"><mtext>predicted weight</mtext><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>350.3</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3.7455</mn><mfenced><mtext>chest circumference</mtext></mfenced></math> (b) The weight of one male tule elk with a chest circumference of <math alttext="145.9 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mn>145.9</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mtext>cm</mtext></math> is <math alttext="204.3 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mn>204.3</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mtext>kg</mtext></math>. (i) Using the equation of the least-squares regression line, calculate the predicted weight for this male tule elk. Show your work.
(ii) Calculate the residual for this male tule elk. Show your work.

The equation of the least-squares regression line relating chest circumference and weight for male tule elk is repeated here. <math alttext="predicted weight equals negative 350.3 plus, 3.7455 times chest circumference" overflow="scroll"><mtext>predicted weight</mtext><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>350.3</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3.7455</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>chest circumference</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> (c) Interpret the slope of the least-squares regression line in context.

(d) The sambar, another species of deer, is similar in size to the tule elk. The slope of the population regression line relating chest circumference and weight for all male sambars is <math alttext="4.5" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.5</mn></math> kilograms per centimeter. A wildlife biologist wants to determine whether the slope of the population regression line for male tule elk is different than that for male sambars. Let <math alttext="beta" overflow="scroll"><mi>β</mi></math> represent the slope of the population regression line for male tule elk. The wildlife biologist conducted a test of the following hypotheses using the sample of <math alttext="30" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn></math> tule elk. <math alttext="H sub 0, colon, beta equals 4.5" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <msub> <mtext>H</mtext> <mtext>0</mtext> </msub> <mo>:</mo> <mo> </mo> <mi>β</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>4.5</mn> </mstyle> </math> <math alttext="H sub a, colon, beta is not equal to 4.5" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <msub> <mtext> H</mtext> <mtext>a</mtext> </msub> <mo>:</mo> <mo> </mo> <mi>β</mi> <mo>≠</mo> <mn>4.5</mn> </mstyle> </math> The test statistic was calculated to be <math alttext="negative 3.408" overflow="scroll"> <mo>-</mo> <mn>3.408</mn> </math>. Assume all conditions for inference were met. (i) Determine the <math alttext="p" overflow="scroll"><mi>p</mi></math>-value of the test.

(ii) At a significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></math>, what conclusion should the wildlife biologist make regarding the slope of the population regression line for male tule elk? Justify your response.

topic.text: 2.4: Representing the Relationship Between Two Quantitative Variables

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
